intro: Sarcomphalus rhodoxylon, commonly known as the redwood tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, woody structure and distinctive reddish bark. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
